abstract.p: Thanks CD for his letter referring to JWS’s bibliographical paper ["Darwinian bibliography", Z. Ethnol. 3 (1871): 56–67]. Will be glad to inform CD of any additions to the list and would be grateful for information on future publications.

revisionDesc.change: Converted to TEI P5 by Michael Hawkins
Automatic links added to bibliographical references in footnotes by Michael Hawkins.
CUL document images added by Digital Innovation and Development, CUL.

div.p: I have been very glad to receive this morning your letter which refers to my little bibliograghic paper in the “Zeitschrift für Ethnologie.” Yesterday evening, when I added some titles to my list, I said to my brother that I had totally forgotten to send you a specimen of my list. You may imagine how I was astonished when Prof. Hartmann, the editor of the “Zeitschrift für Ethnologie” gave me your letter. To show me thankful I shall be glad to inform you of the new publications and some older ones, which I had not yet mentioned in my list. Some of the works which you had the kindness to communicate with me I had already found myself. But no other author neither German nor English has till now sent me any contribution to my list. If you would take the trouble to inform me still once more in future of new publications, I should be greatly obliged; at the same time you may perhaps say me which are the two scientific periodicals, in which my list has been noticed, because I have not yet seem them.
With my best thanks for your communications, I remain dear Sir | yours faithfully | J. W. Spengel. | stud. med.
Dr J. Huber. Die Lehre Darwins, kritisch betrachtet. München 1871.

E. du Bois-Reymond. (Das Kaiserreich und der Friede)— Leibnizische Gedanken in der neueren Naturwissenschaft. Zwei Festreden in öffentlichen Versammlungen der Kgl. preuss. Akademie der Wissenschaften. Berlin 1871
E. v. Hartmann. Die Philosophie des Unbewussten. 2 Auflagen. Berlin 1870.71.

W. Hofmeister. Allgemeine Morphologie der Gewächse. Bd I, Abtheilung 2 des “Handbuchs der physiologischen Botanik in Verbindung mit A de Bary, Th. Irmisch und J. Sachs herausgegeben von W. Hofmeister”. Leipzig 1868
H. I. Klein. Entwicklungsgeschichte des Kosmos nach dem gegenwärtigen Standpunkt der gesammten Naturwissenschaften. Mit wissenschaftlichen Anmerkungen. Braunschweig 1870.
Dr G. Jäger. Zoologische Briefe. Lieferung II Wien 1870
Archiv für Naturgeschichte: 1870. p. 235. W. Veltmann. Die Descendenztheorie aus einigen besonderen Gesichtspunkten betrachtet.
Ausland. 1870. No. 13. Neue Beiträge zu den Streitfragen des Darwinismus, von Moriz Wagner. I Die Descendenztheorie und Die Geologie. No 14 und 15 do.
Gaea. 1870. Heft 6 H. J. Klein. Die Abänderung der Arten.
Naturforscher. 1871. No 15. Die Theorie der “natürlichen Zuchtwahl” vom mathematischen Standpunkte aus betrachtet.

Sitzungsberichte der bayerischen Akademie. München 1870. Bd II, p 154 Moriz Wagner. Ueber den Einfluss der geographischen Isolirung und Colonienbildung für die morphologischen Veränderungen der Organismen.
Deutsche Vierteljahrs-Schrift. 1869. Heft 125. Prof. Reuschle. Philosophie und Wissenschaft, mit besonderer Rücksicht auf Mathematik und Darwinismus.
Dr O. Schmidt. Das Alter der Menschheit. Nach den neueren geologischen Forschungen und Darwins Hypothese. (Gesammelte naturwissenschaftliche Vorträge) Wien, 1871
D. Riolacci. La théorie de Darwin. Conférence faite à l’hôtel de ville de Metz, le 25 janvier 1868.

P. Trémaux. Origine et transformations de l’hommes et des autres bêtes. I. partie indiquant la transformation des êtres organisés, la transformation des espèces, les conditions qui produisent le type, l’instinct, et les facultés intellectuelles, la base des sciences naturelles, historiques, politiques etc. Paris 1865
In the second part of the “Zeitschrift für Ethnologie” shall be published a criticism of your work on the “Descent of Man and Selection in relation to Sex” by Dr A. Bastian.

If there is published in future a work on the theory of natural selection, which is worth to be translated into German, because it gives new facts for the solution of this great problem, I shall always be ready to elaborate a translation, whenever you wish it.

div.note: Bottom of last page: ‘Sach. 2d Edit’ pencil

CD’s letter has not been found. The reference is to Spengel 1871, a bibliography of works on Darwinian theory and other related topics published in Germany since 1860; it also included a brief list of works published in English, French, Dutch, and Italian.

There are two copies of Spengel 1871 in the Darwin Pamphlet Collection–CUL; one is dated 24 August 1871 and contains numerous additions on interleaved pages in the author’s hand (see letter from J. W. Spengel, 4 November 1871). Spengel’s brother has not been identified.
CD’s letter to Eduard von Hartmann has not been found.
No previous correspondence between CD and Spengel has been found.

The references are to J. Huber 1871, Du Bois-Reymond 1871, Hartmann 1870 and 1871, Hofmeister 1868, Klein 1870a, Jäger 1870, Veltmann 1870, Wagner 1871 (a copy of parts 1 and 2 is in the Darwin Pamphlet Collection–CUL), Klein 1870b, Anon. 1871, Wagner 1870, Reuschle 1869, E. O. Schmidt 1870 (a copy of an earlier version, E. O. Schmidt and Unger 1866, is in the Darwin Pamphlet Collection–CUL), Riolacci 1868 (a copy is in the Darwin Pamphlet Collection–CUL), and Trémaux 1865 (copies are in the Darwin Library–CUL and Down).

Adolf Bastian’s review of Descent was published in Zeitschrift für Ethnologie 3 (1871): 133–43; there is also a review by Bastian of the German translation of Descent (Carus trans. 1871) in the same journal issue, pp. 349–59.

The reference is possibly to the second edition of Julius Sachs’s Lehrbuch der Botanik (Sachs 1870). CD’s annotated copy is in the Darwin Library–CUL (see Marginalia 1: 727). The work appears in the second edition of Spengel’s bibliography (Spengel 1872).
